data.title: Musée Delacroix
data.meta_description: The Musée Eugène-Delacroix is located at the heart of Saint-Germain-des-Prés, in the 6th arrondissement of Paris. Address: Musée National (...)
data.text:
The Musée Eugène-Delacroix is located at the heart of Saint-Germain-des-Prés, in the 6th arrondissement of Paris.

Address: Musée National Eugène-Delacroix, 6 Rue de Furstemberg, 75006 Paris

By metro:

Saint-Germain-des-Prés Station (line 4)

Upon exiting the metro, cross the square in front of the Saint-Germain-des-Prés church and head right on Rue de l’Abbaye. Take the first street on your left, which will be Rue de Furstemberg. The museum is directly in front of you, on the left.

Mabillon Station (line 10)

Upon exiting the metro, cross Boulevard Saint Germain and head down Rue de l’Échaudé. Take a left on Rue de l’Abbaye and then right on Rue de Furstemberg. The museum is directly in front of you, on the left.

By bus:

Lines 39, 63, 70, 86, 95, 96 (Saint-Germain-des-Prés stop)

By bicycle: (Vélib’ stations)

141 Boulevard Saint-Germain

1 Rue Saint-Benoît

1 Rue Jacques Callot

10 Rue André Mazet

Walking from the Musée du Louvre

(about 15 minutes)

Leave Place du Carrousel and cross the Pont du Carrousel bridge to Quai Voltaire. Head left until you reach Rue des Saint-Pères (1st street on your left). Take this street until it intersects with Rue Jacob. Turn left on Rue Jacob and walk until you reach Rue de Furstemberg (3rd street on your right). Once you are on Rue de Furstemberg, the museum is located on your right.

You can also take buses 95 or 39, and get off at the Jacob stop.

Parking lots near the museum:
